choices.D: A Controller Extension method that uses SOQL to query for a list of Account records
choices.A: A Controller Extension method that saves a list of Account records
choices.B: Custom JavaScript that processes a list of Account records
choices.C: A list of Account records returned from a Controller Extension method

discussion.content:
The Model in MVC usually stands for the Data structure. One certainty is that sObjects in Salesforce are part of the Model in the MVC.
Therefore, I am thinking C indeed is the correct answer.

The type of code that represents the Model in the MVC architecture when using Apex and Visualforce pages is:

C. A list of Account records returned from a Controller Extension method.

In the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture, the Model represents the data and business logic of the application. In this context, the Model would be the list of Account records returned from the Controller Extension method. The Controller is responsible for handling the logic and data manipulation, and the View is responsible for displaying the data to the user.
It is C, as it is a list of Records.

questions.question_text: Which type of code represents the Model in the MVC architecture when using Apex and Visualforce pages?

choices.D: Lookup relationship from the child to the parent
choices.C: Lookup relationship from the parent to the child

discussion.content: USE ALLOW REPARENTING TO REPARENT A MASTER DEATIL'S CHILD RECORD

To support the given requirements, the appropriate type of relationship to be built between the parent and child objects in Schema Builder is:

A. Master-Detail relationship.

A Master-Detail relationship in Salesforce enforces a strict parent-child relationship between two objects. When a parent record is deleted, all associated child records are also deleted automatically. Additionally, a child record can be easily moved to a different parent by changing the value of the Master-Detail field on the child record.

Therefore, a Master-Detail relationship is the most suitable option for the given requirements.

questions.question_text:
Requirements state that a child record is deleted when its parent is deleted, and a child can be moved to a different parent when necessary.
Which type of relationship should be built between the parent and child objects in Schema builder to support these requirements?

discussion.content: You must use a Developer Edition organization to create and work with a managed package. A Developer Edition organization can contain a single managed package and many unmanaged packages.

questions.question_text: Managed Packages can be created in which type of org?

discussion.content:
A is correct.

https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexcode.meta/apexcode/apex_classes_static.htm

A class static variable can’t be accessed through an instance of that class. If class MyClass has a static variable myStaticVariable, and myClassInstance is an instance of MyClass, myClassInstance.myStaticVariable isn’t a legal expression.

the answer is D not A. You are instantiating a reference to the class InsuranceRates as 'rates', which has a static variable named smokerCharge which is accessible outside of that class. As such, it would be rates.smokerCharge

comments.content: the variable is static and is only accessible as shown in the answer A no instance needed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Static variables should be accessed using the class name, not through an instance of the class.

Selected Answer: A
A - Correct

A class static variable can’t be accessed through an instance of that class. If class MyClass has a static variable myStaticVariable, and myClassInstance is an instance of MyClass, myClassInstance.myStaticVariable isn’t a legal expression.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
a.BECAUSE SMOKERcHARGE IS A STATIC VARIABLE

Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D, b/c the InsuranceRates is instatiated by rates.
